Package org.cesecore.util

Class ConcurrentCache<K,​V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cesecore.util.ConcurrentCache<K,​V>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - Key type
    V - Value type
    public final class ConcurrentCache<K,​V>
extends Object
    A concurrent cache allows multiple threads to cache data. Only one thread will be allowed to generate data for one particular key, and other threads will block. All methods in this class and inner classes are thread-safe.
    Version:
    $Id: ConcurrentCache.java 27456 2017-12-07 10:59:06Z samuellb $

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      class  ConcurrentCache.Entry
      A reference to a cache entry, with a get and put method to read/write data from/to the cache.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConcurrentCache

        public ConcurrentCache()
        Creates an empty concurrent cache

      • ConcurrentCache

        public ConcurrentCache​(Map<? extends K,​? extends V> map,
                       long validFor)
        Creates a concurrent cache initialized with the mapping defined in the given map. Can be used for rebuilding the cache in the background for instance.
        Parameters:
        map - map
        validFor - Time in milliseconds which the entry will be valid for, or -1L for forever.
        See Also:
        getKeys()

    • Method Detail

      • openCacheEntry

        public ConcurrentCache.Entry openCacheEntry​(K key,
                                            long timeout)
        "Opens" a cache entry. If the entry already exists, then an ConcurrentCache.Entry that maps to the existing entry is returned. Otherwise, a semaphore is used to prevent multiple threads from creating the new cache entry. Only the first thread is returned an Entry with isInCache()==false, later threads will block and wait for the first thread. For non-existent entries (i.e. isInCache()==false), the caller is expected to put a value in it and call close() on the Entry.
        Parameters:
        key - Key in the cache.
        timeout - Timeout in milliseconds. The call will only be allowed to block for (approximately) this amount of time.
        Returns:
        An Entry object that maps to an entry in the cache (existing or blank), or null if a timeout occurred.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if key is null.

      • getKeys

        public Set<K> getKeys()
        Returns:
        a set of the keys in the cache. Useful for rebuilding the cache in the background.
        See Also:
        ConcurrentCache(Map, long)

      • setEnabled

        public void setEnabled​(boolean enabled)

        Enables or disables caching. If disabled, nothing will be cached and openCacheEntry will always immediately return an non-existent entry (this may also cause concurrent attempts to fetch/build/etc the same object).

        Disabling the cache doesn't stop any currently "open" cache entries from being written to.

        The default is enabled.

        Parameters:
        enabled - bool

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Returns:
        bool
        See Also:
        setEnabled(boolean)

      • setCloseOnEviction

        public void setCloseOnEviction​(boolean closeOnEviction)

        Turns on or off automatic closure of values on eviction from the cache. Automatic closure can only be done on objects that implement the Closeable interface. Exceptions from the close() method are debug logged and swallowed.

        The default is false.

        Parameters:
        closeOnEviction - bool

      • isCloseOnEviction

        public boolean isCloseOnEviction()
        Returns:
        bool
        See Also:
        setCloseOnEviction(boolean)

      • setMaxEntries

        public void setMaxEntries​(long maxEntries)

        Sets the desired maximum number of entries in the cache. This is not a strict limit, and the cache may temporarily exceed this number.

        The value NO_LIMIT (-1) is the default.

        Parameters:
        maxEntries - Max number of entries

      • getMaxEntries

        public long getMaxEntries()
        Returns:
        max number of entries
        See Also:
        setMaxEntries(long)

      • setCleanupInterval

        public void setCleanupInterval​(long milliseconds)
        Sets the minimum time in milliseconds between two cleanup runs. The default is 1000 (= 1 second).
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - cleanup interval

      • getCleanupInterval

        public long getCleanupInterval()
        Returns:
        cleanup interval
        See Also:
        setCleanupInterval(long)

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all entries in the cache
